snippet: A judge said four government officials did not do enough after an earthquake struck to alert people about a tsunami that eventually left 156 people dead and 25 others missing.
abstract: Chilean judge dismisses appeal to suspend involuntary manslaughter charges against four government officials accused of failing to issue tsunami alert after 8.8-magnitude earthquake that struck Chile in 2010; investigation into deaths of 156 people and disappearance of 25 more seeks to establish responsibility for chain of decisions made by government officials and emergency agencies shortly after earthquake.
lead_paragraph: A judge said four government officials did not do enough after an earthquake struck to alert people about a tsunami that eventually left 156 people dead and 25 others missing.

headline.seo: Chilean Judge Upholds Manslaughter Charges Against Officials Over Tsunami
headline.main: Chilean Judge Upholds Manslaughter Charges Linked to 2010 Tsunami
headline.print_headline: Chilean Judge Rejects Appeal Of Charges In ’10 Tsunami
